events.name: IPv6 Enterprise Deployment Strategies
events.description: Course Description: The course, spread over 3 contact hours, is designed to familarise trainees with the need, characteristics, and benefits of IPv6 in Enterprise Deployment. Learning Points: At the end of the course, trainees will be able to understand:- Need to move beyong IPv4- IPv6 design principles- IPv6 Control Packets- DHCPv6 for Enterprise- Some Best Practices Course Brochure Target Audience:Organisational ICT Managers who need to place and architect for the future technology, TDMs and BDMs for Solution Providers, Network Infrastructure Manager or Directors, CTOs and CIOs, IT HODs. Course Outline:1. Why IPv6  2. IPv6 Addressing- IPv6 Addressing Architecture- IPv6 Packet Header- IPv6 Addresses and Prefixes- IPv6 Subnetting  3. The Neighbor Discovery Protocol- Routers- Neighbors- DAD  4. Addressing Schemes in an Enterprise- SLAAC, with EUI-64 or PE- DHCPv65. DHCPv6 for Enterprise- Overview of DHCPv6- DHCPv6 Operations  6. NPT in Enterprise networks- Provider-Allocated space- Prevent renumbering when changingupstreams  7. A survey of current best practices Course Brochure Entry Criteria•Knowledge of English toWPL 3•Familiarity withadministration of networks•Fundamentalunderstanding of IPv6  Course Duration: 1 day Course Fee:$321 (Inclusive of GST) Enquire Now! Contact Progreso Training Call: 1800 PROGRESO [masked]) Email: [masked] Website: www.progreso.com.sg/training
events.location: Progreso Training Centre, 67 Ubi Road 1 Oxley Bizhub #07-10 Singapore 408730

events.name: Singapore Science Festival: Visual SG: Beauty in Patterns
events.description:
South East Asia’s signature Visualisation Festival, Visual SG, presents a full on visual spectacle of data through the lens of artistic and creative expression. With a line-up of interactive displays, forums and workshops, a highlight includes unwrapping and exploring an Egyptian mummy using an interactive touch table.
 Entry: Admission fees to Science Centre Singapore apply
events.location: Science Centre Singapore, 15 Science Centre Road, Singapore 609081

events.name: Fedora 24 Release Party!
events.description:
Hey all, Bi-annually, Fedora releases a new version of its OS and we are happy to announce that Fedora 24 has been released! We'll be hosting a release party to not only celebrate Fedora's release but also to commemorate our opensource journey so far. We need your suggestions and help to make this community event possible! :) We're looking for speakers! If you would like to speak, as long as it is related to opensource, we would love to hear from you! Do drop us an email and we'll see if it is a good fit! Thanks! (Contact: [masked]) 


* 6:30PM - Food time * 7:15PM - F24, what's new! (Huiren) 



Date: 29 July Location: Ngee Ann Polytechnic, Lecture Theater 51-04C; [call [masked] if you're lost] Sponsor: Amazon Web Services
events.location: Ngee Ann Polytechnic, 535 Clementi Road, Singapore 599489

events.name: Pre-Challenge Workshop 1 (Climate Innovation Challenge 2016)
events.description:
Join us at the first Pre-Challenge Workshop for the Climate Innovation Challenge 2016! This is the perfect session for you if you want to find out more about the challenge statements and be exposed to Internet of Things (IoT) hardware and cloud based machine learning resources by our experts from Microsoft and ESPert.
Program
7.00pm – 7.30pm: Registration7.30pm – 8.00pm: Welcome and general briefing — introduction to challenge statements, introduction to resources available, rules and regulations, Q & A8.00pm – 8.20pm: Participants’ Briefing on data sets for Challenges8.20pm – 9.10pm: Sharing by Microsoft Singapore on Azure for IoT + Machine Learning , by Riza Marhaban and Mohamed Izzat Khair9.10pm – 10.00pm: Sharing by ESPert on the ESP8266 chip, by William Hooi
events.location: IDA Labs, 111 Middle Road, National Design Centre, Level 3, Singapore 188969
